translation.title: The Decline of the True Teaching (1st)

next.name: The Decline of the True Teaching (2nd)

segments.en: 154. The Decline of the True Teaching (1st)

segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ suṇanti, na sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, na sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ dhārenti, na sakkaccaṃ dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhanti, na sakkaccaṃ atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammaṃ paṭipajjanti.
segments.en: It’s when mendicants don’t carefully listen to the teachings, memorize them, and remember them. They don’t carefully examine the meaning of teachings that they remember. And they don’t carefully practice in line with the meaning and the teaching they’ve understood.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the decline and disappearance of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ suṇanti, sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇanti, sakkaccaṃ dhammaṃ dhārenti, sakkaccaṃ dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhanti, sakkaccaṃ atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammaṃ paṭipajjanti.
segments.en: It’s when mendicants carefully listen to the teachings, memorize them, and remember them. They carefully examine the meaning of teachings that they remember. And they carefully practice in line with the meaning and the teaching they’ve understood.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the continuation, persistence, and enduring of the true teaching.”
